title-part.text: TREATMENT OF WATER, WASTE WATER, SEWAGE, OR SLUDGE

reference.text: separation in general B01D; special arrangements on waterborne vessels of installations for treating water, waste water or sewage, e.g. for producing fresh water, B63J; adding materials to water to prevent corrosion C23F; treating radioactively-contaminated liquids G21F9/04; regeneration of reactants for recirculation into processes, see the relevant places for the processes

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in this subclass, classification is also made in group B01D15/08 insofar as subject matter of general interest relating to chromatography is concerned.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
C02F9/02-C02F9/14 covered by C02F9/00 and subgroup
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Treatment of water, waste water, or sewage

CPC-specific-text.text: Processes for the treatment of water whereby the filtration technique is of importance

reference.text: C02F1/44 takes precedence; construction of filters in general B01D24/00 - B01D41/00

CPC-specific-text.text: using small portable filters for producing potable water, e.g. personal travel or emergency equipment, survival kits, combat gear
using household-type filters for producing potable water, e.g. pitchers, bottles, faucet mounted devices
using large scale industrial sized filters
Systems or processes based on supernatural or anthroposophic principles, cosmic or terrestrial radiation, geomancy or rhabdomancy

Water distributors either inside a treatment tank or directing the water to several treatment tanks; Water treatment plants incorporating these distributors, with or without chemical or biological tanks
Control or steering systems not provided for elsewhere in subclass C02F

reference.text: methods of steam generation F22B; preheating boiler feed-water or accumulating preheated boiler feed-water F22D

CPC-specific-text.text: under vacuum produced by a barometric column
Purification of waste water by evaporation

title-part.text: by direct contact with a particulate solid or with a fluid, as a heat transfer medium
using waste heat from other processes
Transportable devices to obtain potable water
by degassing, i.e. liberation of dissolved gases

reference.text: degasification of liquids in general B01D19/00; arrangement of degassing apparatus in boiler feed supply F22D
using ion-exchange C02F1/42; sorbent compositions B01J

CPC-specific-text.text: using coal, charred products, or inorganic mixtures containing them
using natural organic sorbents or derivatives thereof
using composite sorbents, e.g. coated, impregnated, multi-layered

title-part.text: Devices for separating or removing fatty or oily substances or similar floating material

reference.text: cleaning or keeping clear the surface of open water from oil or like materials E02B15/04; devices in sewers for separating liquid or solid substances from sewage E03F5/14, e.g. for use in drains leading to the sewer E03F5/16

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in group C02F1/42, details of ion-exchangers can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C02F2001/422 - C02F2001/427

title-part.text: by dialysis, osmosis or reverse osmosis

reference.text: general membrane separation processes B01D61/00, membrane modules B01D63/00, electrodialysis C02F1/4693, combination of membrane modules and bioreactors C02F3/1268
distillation and evaporation without the use of membranes C02F1/04

CPC-specific-text.text: for prevention or elimination of deposits
for desalination of seawater or brackish water
for producing oligodynamic substances to disinfect the water
Devices therefor; Their operating or servicing

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in group C02F1/46109, details of devices for electrolysis can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C02F2001/46119 - C02F2001/46166

CPC-specific-text.text: Electrodes in particulate form or with conductive and/or non conductive particles between them
Electrodes comprising a substrate and a coating
characterised by the shape or form

reference.text: electrodes in particulate form or with conductive or non-conductive particles between them C02F1/46114

CPC-specific-text.text: for producing "ionised" acidic or basic water

note.note-paragraph: When classifying in group C02F1/4618, details relating to the production of "ionised" acidic or basic water using electrolysis devices can be further indexed by using indexing codes chosen from C02F2001/46185 - C02F2001/46195

CPC-specific-text.text: only anodic or acidic water, e.g. for oxidizing or sterilizing
only cathodic or alkaline water, e.g. for reducing
characterised by the oxidation reduction potential [ORP]
with halogen or compound of halogens, e.g. chlorine, bromine

title-part.text: by electrochemical separation, e.g. by electro-osmosis, electrodialysis, electrophoresis

CPC-specific-text.text: located on the outer wall of the treatment device, i.e. not in contact with the liquid to be treated, e.g. detachable
located on the outer wall of the treatment device, i.e. not in contact with the liquid to be treated, e.g. detachable
using high frequency electromagnetic fields, e.g. pulsed electromagnetic fields
for separation of magnetic materials, e.g. magnetic flocculation

title-part.text: by addition or application of a germicide or by oligodynamic treatment
by flocculation or precipitation of suspended impurities

CPC-specific-text.text: Regulation methods for flocculation or precipitation
Processes for facilitating the dissolution of solid flocculants in water
using basic salts, e.g. of aluminium and iron
using magnesium compounds and phosphoric acid for removing ammonia
Installations for water purification using chemical agents
Processes or devices for preparing lime water

reference.text: using ion-exchange C02F1/42; softening water C02F5/00

CPC-specific-text.text: by removing fluoride or fluorine compounds
Devices for iron precipitation and treatment by air

reference.text: for degassing C02F1/20; using ion-exchange C02F1/42; for flocculation or precipitation of suspended impurities C02F1/52; for removing dissolved compounds C02F1/58

title-part.text: by addition of specified substances, e.g. trace elements, for ameliorating potable water

CPC-specific-text.text: by addition of solid materials for removing an oily layer on water
by addition of chemical compounds for dispersing an oily layer on water
Devices in which the water progressively dissolves a solid compound
using pure oxygen or oxygen rich gas

reference.text: aeration of stretches of water C02F7/00

title-part.text: with halogens or compounds of halogens

CPC-specific-text.text: Devices for the addition of such compounds in gaseous form
by means of halogens other than chlorine or of halogenated compounds containing halogen other than chlorine

title-part.text: Biological treatment of water, waste water, or sewage

CPC-specific-text.text: using granular carriers or supports for the microorganisms
using activated carbon or the like

reference.text: aeration by electrolytically produced oxygen bubbles C02F3/202

CPC-specific-text.text: Biological purification using sources of oxygen other than air, oxygen or ozone
Devices for distributing water over trickle filters
Floating beds with contact bodies having a lower density than water

reference.text: packing elements in general B01J19/30, B01J19/32

CPC-specific-text.text: Immobilising gels, polymers or the like
Particular type of activated sludge processes
Combinations of activated sludge treatment with precipitation, flocculation, coagulation and separation of phosphates
comprising treatment of the recirculated sludge
comprising an absorbent material suspended in the mixed liquor
Particular type of activated sludge installations
Small compact installations for use in homes, apartment blocks, hotels or the like
comprising circular tanks with elements, e.g. decanters, aeration basins, in the form of segments, crowns or sectors
Provisions for mixing or aeration of the mixed liquor
Aeration by saturation under super-atmospheric pressure

title-part.text: the aerator having a vertical axis
the aerator having a horizontal axis

CPC-specific-text.text: Perforated, resilient plastic diffusers, e.g. membranes, sheets, foils, tubes, hoses
Aeration by electrolytically produced oxygen bubbles
Moving, e.g. rotary, diffusers; Stationary diffusers with moving, e.g. rotary, distributors

title-part.text: using pure oxygen or oxygen-rich gas

CPC-specific-text.text: Anaerobic processes using solid supports for microorganisms
using upflow anaerobic sludge blanket [UASB] reactors
comprising septic tanks combined with a filter
Two story combinations of the Imhoff tank type
Aerobic and anaerobic treatment in the same reactor
characterised by direct conversion of nitrite to molecular nitrogen, e.g. by using the Anammox process

title-part.text: characterised by the animals or plants used, e.g. algae

CPC-specific-text.text: as symbiotic combination of algae and bacteria
for digestion of grease, fat, oil
for biological oxidation or reduction of sulfur compounds
characterised by the way or the form in which the microorganisms are added or dosed

title-part.text: Adding scale preventatives or scale removers to water, e.g. adding sequestering agents
Softening water by precipitation of the hardness
Treatment of water with complexing chemicals or other solubilising agents for softening, scale prevention or scale removal, e.g. adding sequestering agents
Multistage treatment of water, waste water, or sewage

note.note-paragraph: This group covers only those combined treating operations where the interest is directed to the relationship between the steps.
This group does not cover, for example, chemical treatment followed by settlement or biological treatment involving normal mechanical treatment.
In this group, the last place priority rule is applied, i.e. at each hierarchical level, in the absence of an indication to the contrary, classification is made in the last appropriate place.

CPC-specific-text.text: Portable or detachable small-scale multistage treatment devices, e.g. point of use or laboratory water purification systems

reference.text: single-stage processes in combination with filtration techniques C02F1/002 or C02F1/003

CPC-specific-text.text: Sludge treatment using liquids immiscible with water
Electrochemical treatment, e.g. electro-oxidation or electro-osmosis
Sludge treatment by fixation or solidification

title-part.text: Production of methane by such processes

reference.text: incinerators for burning waste liquors, e.g. sulfite liquor from paper-making plant F23G7/04

note.note-paragraph:
Groups C02F11/12 - C02F11/128 are impacted by reclassification into groups C02F11/13, C02F11/131, and C02F11/15.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/13 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C02F11/12, C02F11/121, C02F11/122, C02F11/123, C02F11/125, C02F11/126, C02F11/127, C02F11/128, C02F11/18, and C02F11/185.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/131 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C02F11/12, C02F11/121, C02F11/122, C02F11/123, C02F11/125, C02F11/126, C02F11/127, C02F11/128, C02F11/18, and C02F11/185.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/14 is impacted by reclassification into groups C02F11/143, C02F11/145, C02F11/147, and C02F11/148.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/143 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group C02F11/14.
Groups C02F11/14 and C02F11/143 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/145 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group C02F11/14.
Groups C02F11/14 and C02F11/145 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/147 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group C02F11/14.
Groups C02F11/14 and C02F11/147 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Combined use of inorganic and organic substances, being added in the same treatment step

note.note-paragraph:
Group C02F11/148 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group C02F11/14.
Groups C02F11/14 and C02F11/148 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: by treatment with electric, magnetic or electromagnetic fields

reference.text: for the purpose of heating C02F11/131

note.note-paragraph:
Group C02F11/15 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from groups C02F11/12, C02F11/121, C02F11/122, C02F11/123, C02F11/125, C02F11/126, C02F11/127, C02F11/128, C02F11/18, and C02F11/185.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/18 is impacted by reclassification into groups C02F11/13, C02F11/131, and C02F11/15.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

Group C02F11/185 is impacted by reclassification into groups C02F11/13, C02F11/131, and C02F11/15.
All groups listed in this Warning should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Heavy metals or heavy metal compounds
Chromium or chromium compounds, e.g. chromates
Nature of the water, waste water, sewage or sludge to be treated

CPC-specific-text.text: Grey water, e.g. from clothes washers, showers or dishwashers
Wastewater from hospitals, laboratories and the like, heavily contaminated by pathogenic microorganisms
Contaminated open waterways, rivers, lakes or ponds
Originating from marine vessels, ships and boats, e.g. bilge water or ballast water

title-part.text: Non-contaminated water, e.g. for industrial water supply

CPC-specific-text.text: Treating water for medical or cosmetic purposes

title-part.text: from quarries or from mining activities
from the silicate or ceramic industries, e.g. waste waters from cement or glass factories
from metallurgical processes, i.e. from the production, refining or treatment of metals, e.g. galvanic wastes
from the purification of gaseous effluents
from the processing of animals, e.g. poultry, fish, or parts thereof
from the processing of plants or parts thereof
from the paper or cellulose industry
from the food or foodstuff industry, e.g. brewery waste waters

CPC-specific-text.text: from vegetable oil production, e.g. olive oil production
from processes relating to the production of wine products
from processes relating to the production of dairy products

title-part.text: from industrial activities not provided for in groups C02F2103/12 - C02F2103/32

CPC-specific-text.text: from the pharmaceutical industry, e.g. containing antibiotics
from semiconductor processing, e.g. waste water from polishing of wafers

title-part.text: from the manufacture of organic compounds
from the manufacture or use of photosensitive materials
from bathing facilities, e.g. swimming pools
Apparatus for treatment of water, waste water or sewage
Build in apparatus for autonomous on board water supply and wastewater treatment (e.g. for aircrafts, cruiseships, oil drilling platforms, railway trains, space stations)
Coaxial constructions, e.g. a cartridge located coaxially within another
Mobile apparatus and plants, e.g. mounted on a vehicle
Apparatus with independent power supply, e.g. solar cells, windpower, fuel cells
Lamps suspended above a water surface or pipe
Single elongated lamp located on the central axis of a turbular reactor
Units using UV-light guiding optical fibers
Lamps immersed in an open channel, containing the liquid to be treated
Units with two or more lamps
Units having reflectors, e.g. coatings, baffles, plates, mirrors
Details relating to the electrolytic devices
Electrolytic cell with membranes or diaphragms
Special power supply, e.g. solar energy or batteries
Supplying or removing reactants or electrolyte
Recycling the cathodic or anodic feed
Devices for applying magnetic or electric fields
Details relating to ozone treatment devices
Apparatus and plants for the biological treatment of water, waste water or sewage
comprising a selector reactor for promoting floc-forming or other bacteria
details of construction, e.g. specially adapted seals, modules, connections
Mobile apparatus and plants, e.g. mounted on a vehicle
Controlling or monitoring parameters in water treatment
Upstream control, i.e. monitoring for predictive control
Downstream control, i.e. outlet monitoring, e.g. to check the treating agents, such as halogens or ozone, leaving the process
Processes using a programmable logic controller [PLC]
comprising a software program or a logic diagram
comprising telecommunication features, e.g. modems or antennas
Solids, e.g. total solids [TS], total suspended solids [TSS] or volatile solids [VS]
Particle number, particle size or particle characterisation
Biological material, e.g. enzymes or ATP
Treatment of partial or bypass streams
Multistage treatments, e.g. repetition of the same process step under different conditions
Odour removal or prevention of malodour
Removal of treatment agents after treatment
The treatment agent being halogen or a halogenated compound
Eliminating or preventing deposits, scale removal, scale prevention
Separation of coarse particles, e.g. by using sieves or screens
Reducing the size of particles, liquid droplets or bubbles, e.g. by crushing, grinding, spraying, creation of microbubbles or nanobubbles
Use of specific compounds during water treatment
Reactive oxygen species, singlet oxygen, OH radical
Surfactants, used as part of a formulation or alone
Nutrients for stimulating the growth of microorganisms
Inert solids used as ballast for improving sedimentation
Additives which dissolves or releases substances when predefined environmental conditions are reached, e.g. pH or temperature
Location of water treatment or water treatment device
as part of a pitcher or jug
Mounted on or being part of a faucet, shower handle or showerhead
Treatment of wastewater in the sewer, e.g. to reduce grease, odour
as part of a potable water dispenser, e.g. for use in homes or offices
as part of household appliances such as dishwashers, laundry washing machines or vacuum cleaners
Treatment of water in water supply networks, e.g. to prevent bacterial growth
